meanings.definition: To plunge into water or other liquid.
meanings.sent1: She decided to douse her feet in the cool stream on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter had to douse the flames to save the house.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally doused himself with water while trying to water the plants.
meanings.sent4: The sudden rain doused the city in a refreshing shower.
meanings.sent5: The children loved to douse each other with water balloons in the backyard.

meanings.definition: To extinguish a fire by drenching with water.
meanings.sent1: The quick-thinking neighbor rushed to douse the small kitchen fire.
meanings.sent2: The firefighters worked tirelessly to douse the raging forest fire.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly threatened to douse the burnt toast with water to put out the 'fire.'
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain came just in time to douse the flames threatening the village.
meanings.sent5: The fire department used helicopters to douse the wildfire from above.

meanings.sent1: She liked to douse her pancakes with maple syrup.
meanings.sent2: The chef would douse the salad with a tangy dressing before serving.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally doused the table with ketchup while trying to open the bottle.
meanings.sent4: The celebratory team would douse the coach with Gatorade after a big win.
meanings.sent5: The gardener would douse the plants with fertilizer to help them grow.
